code_quality.details: Good separation of concerns with routes/database modules. Swagger annotations are thorough. However, two dead functions remain in app.js (unusedHelper, anotherDeadFunction). console.log statements left in production code. DB_PASSWORD variable declared but never used. Uses parameterized queries (good).

documentation.details: README lists endpoints and data structure but remains basic. Swagger UI is active at /api-docs with detailed OpenAPI annotations in routes. .env.example present. Missing Docker instructions and badge integration.

teams.summary: Solid foundation with good Swagger docs and clean route structure, but dead code in app.js drags the score down.
tips: Remove the unusedHelper() and anotherDeadFunction() from app.js — they're dead code that hurts readability
Replace console.log with a proper logger (e.g. pino or winston) or remove debug logs from production
Add CI/CD badges and Docker setup instructions to your README

code_quality.details: Clean route structure with Swagger integration. Major issue: /debug endpoint openly exposes SECRET_KEY and API_KEY with no environment guard. documentation.details: README is minimal — just 'a todo api' with npm commands and SonarCloud badges. No endpoint documentation, no env var list, no Docker instructions. Swagger UI is active which helps.

code_quality.details: Clean, minimal code. Uses helmet for security headers (great). Global error handler present. eval() was removed from search (good fix with comment). However, .env file is committed to the repo — this is a security issue. No Swagger.

documentation.details: README is the default template: 'a todo api' with npm install/start. No endpoint docs, no env vars, no Docker, no badges. No Swagger/OpenAPI integration. No code comments.

teams.summary: Code quality is above average with helmet and a global error handler, but documentation is severely lacking. The committed .env file is a concern.
tips: Move secrets to environment variables (.env) — never commit credentials. Add .env to .gitignore and add a .env.example instead
Add Swagger/OpenAPI docs — Express can use swagger-jsdoc + swagger-ui-express
Update your README with real setup instructions, API docs, and badges
